content.description: The crux is about at 3rd clip and as long as you are good at pulling on pockets you're alright!
content.location: In the middle of the cliff.

content.description:
Climb the dirty off-width crack to the right of Shakis.  A bouldery start leads to easier but run-out climbing above.  Make sure you don't pull off the large boulders when you top out.  This route can be top roped by locating a chicken head just to the left (facing the canyon) of the pillar on top.  If you set up a top rope, bring long webbing (20-30 feet) or get creative with your rope and extend the anchors to a ledge below and belay from above.

If you have info on the original name or FA, let me know.
content.protection: Take a #3 and #4 BD cam, a few smaller cams, and some webbing to sling the chokes lodged in the crack.

content.description: Starts 10 feet right of Prelude to an Illness.  It might share anchors with Prelude as well.
Climb the chimney to the right of Babe-a-licious to the large overhanging roof. Traverse under the roof (Crux, balancey). Top out just to the right of the roof.
content.location: 4th climb from the left (just to the right of babe-a-licious.)

content.description: This short 3 bolter is more of a highball boulder problem, but not one most would want to try to solo. A powerful move to get off the ground leads to the obvious and positive pocket in which you must poke. If you don't poke this pocket you are not allowed to say you climbed this route. Some insecure crimps out left lead to a huge juggy finish and mantel. A great route for the sprouting .11 leader.
content.location: Just left(west) of the tree that you must squirm through to reach the east end of the crag. Look for the poked pocket.

content.description: The crux is toward the beginning if I remember correctly

climbs.name: The Fairy
climbs.fa: J. Rhodes, C. Barns, B. Boyle, R. Mitchel

content.description: The left most passage on the low angle grey rock

climbs.name: Betagraphic
climbs.fa: C. Barnes, B. Boyle, R. Mitchel

content.description: face holds and pockets to roof and finish.
content.location: 2nd set of bolts from the left.

content.description: This route has a bouldery beginning that starts in a couple of good pockets then moves up and left on some sparse crimps, finger pockets, and a sidepull.  Make sure and find the feet, they are there.  The climbing eases up in the middle, then you can cruise up the top.  Once you figure out the sequence at the beginning it feels accurately rated at 10c.
content.protection: I believe this is 6 or 7 bolts.  Ends at chains.  This shares an anchor with Holy Toledo.
content.location: This is the climb just to the left of Holy Toledo, on the other side of the tree.  If you start on the right side of Betagraph it's the third climb to the left.

content.description: Great climb, well protected the crux is at the top, 2 bolts from the top i believe. A little pumpy, but moves so well, and has a couple good rest spots.
content.location: It is the third climb starting from the left of betagraph. Just right of betagraphic (5.11c)

content.description: Super fun and super juggy. Climbed it in the dark with headlamps and can wait to go back. half way up the crux is just tricky feet
content.protection: six bolts then a bit of a run out to the chains
content.location: The furthest route to the right on the Betagraph wall. Right next to Holy Toledo.
